s.text: But the courts ruled that because cola was a common word describing what was in the beverage, any soda containing cola derivatives could be called a cola . Coke's trademark was upheld against Chero-Cola, Clio-Cola, Coca and Cola , and El-Cola ; ruled to be non-infringing were Koke, Dope, Cherry-Cola, Roxa-Cola , and Dixie-Cola . As for other sodas, Moxie won its case against Noxie , but Pepsi-Cola lost against Pep , as did Seven-Up against Cheer Up .
The Xerox Corporation, recognizing the potential danger of success, has in the past gone out of its way to protect its right to the words it owns.
